title: The Malzahar change is workable except for 1 part
body: Dragon and baron oneshot voidlings now which takes away a ton of his team utility. I understand doing less damage to objectives was probably one of the goals of this change, but now he can barely contribute which is a huge nerf compared to his prechange state. I would even be ok with them tanking 3 hits for consistency because you can space out w casts now, but he really needs something.

My biggest problem with new Malz changes is how weak voidlings are to AoE.

For example, I chased a 40% health rengar into my jungle early game, and spend my precious 80 mana to spawn two voidlings and punish him for his bad decision making. That Rengar pressed W. All voidlings instant killed. That's it. We pressed W and my entire combo was ruined. I had to run back to tower and even flash to survive.

So, I later ganked a Nasus in top lane. Used my W twice to prepare for my combo. Oops, Nasus had used his circle skill against my top ally. Voidlings instant killed. Accidently. I had to run back to tower, and then back to mid, and it was all a big waste of time, farm and mana.

So I actually just played a game as Malz.  (previously was rank 6 mastery on him before the change)

I did absolutely ridiculous amounts of damage at level 2, almost one shot the enemy laner from full health with W+E; they escaped with flash and 50 hp remaining.

After that... yeah, I felt the wave pushing was much weaker, and he went from being top tier objective taking to being near useless on them, just as you said.

I felt my teamfight and champion damage was pretty good still, but it is strange that they decided to go with such a huge nerf to his objective control.

I mean if someone walks up to you and lets you e-w-w and stands on them that would work. Outside of very new players or people who aren't familiar with his voidlings I don't see that happening. The same thing could be done with prechange malz too, anyone who ran at you and ignored e-w would almost die to voidlings.

You can double-W _really_ fast.  The first couple times I used my W, I actually thought it just used both charges with one cast.  If you hit E, by the time you even finish the casting animation both voidlings can be out already.

It's actually a bit better in the burst territory, especially in the first few seconds when you're holding them down with ult - you get two voidlings immediately, which means you start off twice as strong and propagate them twice as fast.  It's after a few seconds - when your new ones stop multiplying but the old ones would have kept going and you no longer get the attack speed buff for them - that your damage actually starts to fall off compared to before.

Oh, and smiting the first voidling to stop the whole swarm isn't really a thing anymore, since you get a second one, so that's a thing I guess.

He's honestly still fine... I think.  Maybe.  Time will tell.  Maybe I'll start leveling my Q second again and use that to nuke waves just like old times.
